info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 30 at 10:42AM CDT until June 30 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Jewell and Smith.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. There is continued flooding along White Rock Creek.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1038 AM CDT, Heavy rain fell earlier due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cedar Creek, Dry Creek, East Oak Creek, Rankin Creek, Spring Creek, North Branch White Rock Creek, Johns Creekr, Troublesome Creek, East Branch Troublesome Creek, Ayres Creek, Crooked Auger Creek, East Marsh Creek, Frog Creek, Lovewell Reservoir Area, West Penny Creek, Antelope Creek, Louisa Creek, Middle Limestone Creek, Pawnee Creek, White Rock Creek, Burr Oak Creek, Lost Creek, Rock Creek, Middle Oak Creek, West Oak Creek, Hicks Creek, Crosby Creek, Johns Creek, Penny Creek, Republican River, Advent Creek, Limestone Creek, Monkey Run Creek, Oak Creek, Long Branch, Ash Creek, Korb Creek, Walnut Creek, East Fork Big Timber Creek, Porcupine Creek and Big Timber Creek. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lebanon, Burr Oak, Esbon, Webber, Bellaire and Lovewell State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING
